stltoday.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of the St. Louis Post-Dispatch, a daily newspaper based in St. Louis, Mo. covering local, regional, national, and world news.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

Lee Enterprises, a publicly traded company, owns the St. Louis Post-Dispatch. It owns 45 otherdaily newspapers (and has a joint interest in two others), nearly 300 specialty publications and a range of digital products. Lee bought the St. Louis Post-Dispatch from Pulitzer Inc. in 2005.

Content

Much of the paper’s coverage concentrates on news in the St. Louis metropolitan area and portions of Illinois, written by staff reporters. It publishes major national and world stories from wire services such as The Associated Press. Reporting includes politics, crime, education, business, entertainment, lifestyle, and sports news. A section is also dedicated to high school sports.

The St. Louis Post-Dispatch has a robust opinion section featuring editorials, op-eds written by staff columnists and guest writers, and letters to the editor. Its editorial staff has endorsed every Democratic presidential candidate since 1980.

Users can read a limited number of articles for free each month before they must pay for full access to the site. An online archive gives subscribers access to  stories and past editions dating back to 1874.

Credibility

Stories published by the St. Louis Post-Dispatch are objective and fact-based, citing first-hand reporting and interviews. The paper also publishes photos taken by staff photographers. Opinionated content appears in its own section and is clearly marked.

Articles are regularly updated when an error has been made and corrections are noted at the bottom of the story. A Contact Us page instructs readers who want to submit a correction to contact the editor in charge of the section in which the error occurred.

The St. Louis Post-Dispatch has won 19 Pulitzer Prizes since 1926,  including one in 2015 Pulitzer for its photos of protests in Ferguson, Mo.,

Transparency

Bylines in STLToday.com link to an archive of the writer’s work. Most staff members provide a short bio and their email address, as well as links to their social media profiles. Registered users can “follow” each writer, which allows them to receive emails with content by writers they select.

A Contact Us page lists the newsroom staff, including each employee’s full name, position, and email address. Phone numbers and Twitter handles are listed for many staff members on a dedicated page. The paper’s, phone number, physical address, and other contact information, areis also provided.

The St. Louis Post-Dispatch clearly discloses its relationship with Lee Enterprises. Advertisements and sponsored content are identified as such.

History

Joseph Pulitzer, a pioneer of modern American journalism, founded the St. Louis Post-Dispatch in 1878 when he purchased the St. Louis Dispatch at a public auction and merged it with the St. Louis Post. Its original name, the St. Louis Post and Dispatch, was shortened after two weeks.

In his will, Pulitzer established the Pulitzer Prizes, print and digital journalism’s highest honor. He also endowed $2 million in his will to help create Columbia University’s School of Journalism, which was opened in 1912 and oversees the Pulitzer Prizes.
